body: The cost of this task is **30 mins** (this is exactly how much will be paid, not less not more), when the task is done
@asinyagin can you please help? Keep in mind [this](http://www.tpc2.com/dev/principles). If you have any technical questions, don't hesitate to ask right here

@yegor256 I see three ways to test it:
- Specify an id of some another user's gist in a pom.xml and fork it.
- Create second account, declare its credentials in a pom.xml and prepare necessary data by hand.
- The same approach as in the previous way, but necessary data is created by code.

Which way should I choose?

I'm re-naming it from

> Gist.java:62-63: Integration test for fork() method...

to

> Gist.java:55-56: Integration test for fork() method...
@yegor256 can you help me with the question above? I have the same problem with an issue #185.
I think that the best approach would be to create the second account and specify its OAuth key in `pom.xml`

@yegor256 I've found a bug I've made earlier. There is a problem in gist reading and writing. I didn't run an integration test and missed it. And I can't complete this issue until this bug will be fixed. Can I fix this bug now or should I create a new issue for it?
It's always better to create a new issue for any bug you find (no matter who and when introduced the bug)
@asinyagin since there is no activity in the last few days in this task I decided to ask you to let us know what's going on... How are things going?
@dmarkov this issue is blocked by issue #245.

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)
